data.message: I have asked twice under "Report a Problem" for a fix on how to get Marketplace on my desktop computer and my iphone. Can someone please answer me??

replies.message: Thanks for reaching out, Brandon. Marketplace is currently available to people over 18 in the US, UK, Australia, New Zealand and Mexico on the Facebook app for iPhone (iPhone 5 and more recent models) and Android (mobile devices only). We will continue expanding to additional countries and make Marketplace available on the desktop version of Facebook in the coming months. Please also verify that you have the latest version of the Facebook app on your phone. -Brittany
I am in the US and have the latest versions. Very frustrating
We hear your frustration, Brandon. If something's not working on Facebook, please let us know: http://bit.ly/2r6gSuc. -Brittany
Like I said, I have reported the problem twice and no one has responded or offered advice

We appreciate your patience as our team reviews your report, Brandon. In the meantime, you may be able to track the status of your report in the Support Dashboard. Visit our Help Center to learn more: on.fb.me/RvGnjd. -Brittany
Are you kidding me? Facebook posts a beautiful speech made by their CEO and the top responses they are getting are complaints?
If you want to know how it works, read the manual, explore, ask assistance from friends or relatives. Don't bother people you don't know with your own problems.

Hi, Brandon. unfortunately facebook is at an all time low. Their Help and Support response lacks intelligence. Fortunately there are better and more interactive social media with a better online experience. Facebook's relevance is due to it's early start with smartphone apps and stolen ideas and concepts, while recently adding features that myspace had for years. If you would like a better social media experience, twitter is for you.
